caddy_custom_http.description: Raw http configuration in python template format. Your site will be rejected if you use it without notification and approval of frontend administrators
caddy_custom_http.title: HTTP configuration

caddy_custom_https.description: Raw https configuration in python template format. Your site will be rejected if you use it without notification and approval of frontend administrators
caddy_custom_https.title: HTTPS configuration

custom_domain.description: Custom Domain to use for the website
custom_domain.title: Custom Domain

default-path.description: Provide default path to redirect user to when user access / (the site root)
default-path.title: type:zope Default Path

disable-no-cache-request.description: If set to true, Cache-Control and Pragma requests headers will not be sent to cache and backend servers. This prevents clients from bypassing cache when enable_cache is true
disable-no-cache-request.title: enable_cache: Disable 'no-cache' requests

disable-via-header.description: If set to true, Via response headers will not be sent to client
disable-via-header.title: enable_cache: Disable 'Via' headers from cache

disabled-cookie-list.description: List of Cookies separated by space that will not be sent to cache and backend servers. This is especially useful to discard analytics tracking cookies when using Vary: Cookie cache headers
disabled-cookie-list.title: Disabled Cookies

enable-http2.description: Use HTTP2 Protocol for the site
enable-http2.title: Enable HTTP2 Protocol

enable_cache.description: If set to true, http caching server (Apache Traffic Server) will be used between frontend Caddy and backend
enable_cache.title: Enable Cache

https-only.description: If set to true, http requests will be redirected to https
https-only.title: HTTPS Only

https-url.description: HTTPS Url of the backend if it is diferent from url parameter
https-url.title: HTTPS Backend URL

monitor-ipv4-test.description: IPv4 Address for the frontend keep monitoring with ping
monitor-ipv4-test.title: IPv4 Address to Monitor Packet Lost

monitor-ipv6-test.description: IPv6 Address for the frontend keep monitoring with ping6 (without brackets)
monitor-ipv6-test.title: IPv6 Address to Monitor Packet Lost

path.description: Path to proxy to in the backend
path.title: type:zope Backend Path

prefer-gzip-encoding-to-backend.description: If set to true, frontend will rewrite Accept-Encoding request header to simply 'gzip' for all variants of Accept-Encoding containing 'gzip', in order to maximize cache hits for resources cached with Vary: Accept-Encoding when enable_cache is used
prefer-gzip-encoding-to-backend.title: Prefer gzip Encoding for Backend

re6st-optimal-test.description: IPv6 and IPv6 Address for the frontend test if re6st is on the optimal status (use ipv6,ipv4)
re6st-optimal-test.title: IPv6 and IPv4 Address to test Re6st

server-alias.description: Server Alias List separated by space
server-alias.title: Server Alias

ssl-proxy-verify.description: [NOT Implemented] If set to true, Backend SSL Certificates will be checked and frontend will refuse to proxy if certificate is invalid
ssl-proxy-verify.title: [NOT Implemented] Verify Backend Certificates

ssl_crt.description: Content of the SSL Certificate file. If the certificate is signed by CA, it can be bundled with by concatenting of the server's certificate followed by the CA's certificate.
ssl_crt.title: SSL Certificate

ssl_key.description: Content of the SSL Key file
ssl_key.title: SSL Key

ssl_proxy_ca_crt.description: [NOT Implemented] Content of the SSL Certificate Authority file of the backend (to be used with ssl-proxy-verify)
ssl_proxy_ca_crt.title: [NOT Implemented] SSL Backend Authority's Certificate

type.description: Type of slave. If redirect, the slave will redirect to the given url. If zope, the rewrite rules will be compatible with Virtual Host Monster. Implemented are default, zope and redirect, not implemneted are notebook and eventsource.
type.title: Backend Type

virtualhostroot-http-port.description: Port where http requests to frontend will be redirected.
virtualhostroot-http-port.title: type:zope virtualhostroot-http-port

virtualhostroot-https-port.description: Port where https requests to frontend will be redirected.
virtualhostroot-https-port.title: type:zope virtualhostroot-https-port
